properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Post tropical storm Erin will track across Prince Edward Island Friday morning. Rain at times heavy and gusty winds are expected as it moves through. Total rainfall amounts of up to 40 mm are currently expected over Kings County. Strong southeasterly winds gusting up to 60 km/h will develop overnight and then diminish Friday morning as winds shift to the west. At this time, there remains some uncertainty in the track of the system and should it shift eastward, a rainfall warning may be issued. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to PEstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #PEStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-30T08:46:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-30T00:47:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1279697346.2019
Area: Kings County P.E.I.
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Post tropical storm Erin will cross western Nova Scotia tonight and then track into the Gulf of St. Lawrence Friday morning. Rain at times heavy and gusty winds are expected across most of Nova Scotia as it moves through. Total rainfall amounts of up to 45 mm are expected for the South Shore and central Nova Scotia. Lesser amounts are expected across eastern areas of the province. Should the track shift further east, rainfall warnings may be expanded. Southeasterly wind gusts to 60 or 70 km/h are expected to develop this evening and overnight. Winds will shift to the west and then diminish Friday morning. In addition, waves near 4 metres will spread from west to east along the Atlantic Coast of Nova Scotia and will break higher along the beaches. Rip currents may also be an issue, and the public should exercise caution near the coast. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-30T08:48:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-30T00:49:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1326980187.2019
Area: Halifax County - east of Porters Lake, Pictou County, Guysborough County, Antigonish County, Richmond County, Inverness County - south of Mabou, Inverness County - Mabou and north, Victoria County, Sydney Metro and Cape Breton County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Post tropical storm Erin is forecast to cross Nova Scotia tonight and enter the Gulf of St. Lawrence Friday morning. Rain will begin this evening and taper off near noon Friday behind the system. Total rainfall amounts near 30 mm are expected. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.

properties.Title: Les Suêtes Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong southeasterly winds will develop overnight with gusts reaching 110 km/h from Margaree Harbour to Bay St. Lawrence. These strong gusts will diminish Friday morning when winds will shift to the south. ### Les Suêtes wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-30T16:45:09-00:00

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strengthening northerly winds will affect Kivalliq tonight as a low pressure system continues to intensify in Hudson Bay. Winds will increase to 70 gusting 90 km/h tonight along most of the Hudson Bay coast and remain strong for much of Friday before gradually diminishing into Saturday. Other regions will see gusts near 80 km/h tonight through Friday. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-30T11:38:31-00:00

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. Extensive fog can be expected at Cape Dorset tonight through much of the weekend as a large, slow-moving low pressure system gradually drifts towards the community. The fog may lift somewhat at times, especially when heavier bands of rain affect the community, but in general extended periods of zero to near zero visibility can be expected for the remainder of the week and much of the weekend. The fog may begin to dissipate Sunday afternoon depending on the location of the low pressure system. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-30T12:39:25-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-29T20:40:25-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0374723242.2019

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A large low pressure system over Hudson Bay will continue to bring significant rain to Kimmirut tonight accompanied by strong southeast winds gusting to 60 km/h. The rain, heavy at times, will continue through tonight before tapering off on Friday. Total accumulations between 30-50 mm are expected by Friday morning. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
